name: cork
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] the light, soft bark (= outer covering) of a Mediterranean tree
[ C ] a short, cylinder-shaped piece of cork, plastic, or rubber that is put into the top of a bottle, especially a wine bottle, to close it: I can't get the cork out of the bottle - can you try?
malerapaso/E+/GettyImages

You can also find related words, phrases, and synonyms in the topics:
Lids, covers and stoppers
to close a bottle by putting a cork in it: I'll cork the bottle and we can drink the rest later.

cork something up
Add to word list
Add to word list
a light material obtained from the bark (= outer layer) of a tree, or a small, soft cylinder of this material that is pushed into the top of a bottle to close it: [ C ] The waiter took the cork out of the bottle.
